sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: China holds unprecedented live fire drills off Taiwan's coast in protest to the controversial visit of U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to the self-ruled island.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Lebanon marks the second anniversary of the massive explosion that wrecked Beirut's port and destroyed large parts of the Lebanese capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And NGOs conducting search and rescue operations in the Mediterranean call on Brussels for help with the rise in the number of attempted crossings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: China is holding a series of unprecedented live fire drills in protest at the controversial visit to self-ruled Taiwan by U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: These drills include missile tests and what's called other military operations, some to be carried out within Taiwan's territorial waters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In the next three days, both air and sea traffic in the area are barred, effectively blockading Taiwan, which Beijing views as a breakaway province.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: China is accusing the U.S. of undermining Beijing's One China policy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Chinese military's conducting of drills in the sea near China's Taiwan are a necessary and just measure to resolutely protect national sovereignty and territorial integrity in response to the major provocative moves by some U.S. politicians and Taiwan independence forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Pelosi left on Wednesday saying the visit had been to show solidarity with democratic Taiwan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But in her wake, there is growing unease at Chinese response. In an effort to calm the situation, foreign ministers from the G7 nations released a joint statement saying China's escalation risks destabilizing the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The White House has repeated its message that the trip has changed nothing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There is no reason for Beijing to turn this visit, which is consistent with long-standing U.S. policy, into some sort of crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There is no reason to do that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We have been very clear there is no change in our one China policy, which is guided by the Taiwan Relations Act of 1979.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: That has not changed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, various protesters staged a demonstration outside the U.S. consulate in Hong Kong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Pelosi's visit has attracted intense global scrutiny and anger from pro-Beijing groups.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Today, Beirut is marking the second anniversary of the massive explosion that wrecked its port, destroyed large parts of the Lebanese capital and devastated livelihoods.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Today the warehouse is still there and only last week the 48 metre long grain storage facility was partially destroyed due to a fire that had begun only a month ago. Officials have closed off all roads leading to the harbour. Two years ago, explosive materials were unsafely stored for years within the Great Silo, triggering a gigantic explosion that shook the entire city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Approximately 200 people lost their lives, more than 6,000 people were injured and 300 people were displaced due to the explosion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: were displaced due to the explosion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The 2020 blast is widely seen by Lebanese as a symbol of corruption and bad governance by a ruling elite that has also steered the country into a devastating financial collapse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Lebanon remains devastated by a tragedy that has affected many families two years after the explosion in the port of Beirut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Among them, Paul and Tracy Nagir, the parents of Alexandra, one of the youngest victims of the explosion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Still in mourning over the death of their three-year-old daughter, the family lives in grief and anger because of the paralysis of the investigation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We always say that we will fight for justice and for the truth until the day we die.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And if we die and there's still no justice, I want Aqsaid to carry on the cause too.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's important for me that he lives from now, from a young age, this new life that has become our life, this life of struggle for justice, truth, for life before August 4th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The family, as well as many other Lebanese, accuse politicians of complicity and negligence in the aftermath of the explosion. Lebanese MP and lawyer, Melam Khalaf, had filed a complaint against the state on behalf of a collective of victims.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But the investigations were also suspended.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They plunged this case into political disputes and turned the demand for the truth into a subjective matter, each one contesting it. Politicians must lift their hand off to the justice system so that it can first achieve the rights and then the justice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: On August 4th, 2020, the lives of thousands of residents of Beirut were turned upside down, with 200 deaths and 6,000 injuries in a city struggling to recover.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Europe's largest nuclear plant is completely out of control. That's the chilling warning from the UN's nuclear chief, who says the situation at Ukraine's Zaporizhia plant is getting more perilous with each passing day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russian troops have been occupying the site since it was seized in early March, shortly after the start of their invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: For any nuclear facility to operate normally and safely, there are a number of principles and norms that must be observed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And when we look at the situation, the very unique situation we have in Zaporizhia, we see that most of them, if not all, are being violated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Rafael Grossi made an urgent plea to Kiev and Moscow, asking that experts be allowed to visit the sprawling complex in order to stabilize the situation and avoid a nuclear accident. Elsewhere on the battlefront, Russia's defense ministry claimed its missiles destroyed a depot containing weapons supplied by Poland in Ukraine's Lviv region. On the same day, Ukraine's military issued footage of its forces launching advanced mid-range rocket systems supplied by the U.S. In a new report from rights group Amnesty International, both Kyiv and Moscow were criticized for endangering civilians in the war and violating international humanitarian law. Russia was slammed for its indiscriminate missile strikes and Ukraine for staging military operations in populated residential areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On the diplomatic front, Ukraine's President Zelensky met with Estonia's foreign minister in Kyiv, thanking Talin for sending much-needed funds to rebuild his country's damaged infrastructure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Stores belonging to the Swedish clothing giant H&M Group temporarily opened in Moscow on

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Tuesday for a final sell-off before leaving the Russian market.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Stores include H&M, H&M Home as well as other smaller chains.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: People could be seen queuing outside the H&M shop at Metropolis Mall in Moscow. In a statement, the group says the stores will remain open until most of the stock is sold out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On the 28th of July, it was announced that H&M decided to sell its business in Russia amid the ongoing war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: According to the Russian Ministry of Industry and Trade, the stores will be available for purchase by domestic or foreign buyers from friendly countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The oil-producing cartel OPEC and its allies led by Russia

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: announced an increase in crude oil production of 100,000 barrels a day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The minuscule hike is being seen as an insult directed at U.S. President Joe Biden, who recently visited OPEC member Saudi Arabia to ask the group to pump more to help the ailing global economy. The increase in output is the equivalent of 0.1 percent of global demand.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Supporters of Iraqi cleric Muqtada Sadr are continuing their sit-in for a fifth consecutive day inside Iraq's parliament headquarters in the capital Baghdad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They're protesting a rival bloc's nomination for prime minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Sadr, whose bloc won the most seats in Iraq's elections last year, has demanded that parliament be dissolved and new elections called.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Warning protests will continue until demands are met.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: New clashes erupted between Armenian and Azerbaijani forces in the separatist region of Nagorno-Karabakh. Both sides blame each other for the fighting. Nagorno-Karabakh military officials said two of their troops were killed in an Azerbaijani drone attack, while Azerbaijan's defense ministry said one of its service members was killed by what it called illegal Armenian armed groups.
